page.title: 07WINSTON VILLAGE FACILITIES
page.content: For those seeking softer surroundings, a small restaurant, "The Winston Churchill" panders to their needs. The restaurant draws people from far and wide, and its situation, secluded behind the village Post Office, does not impinge upon village life. For those travellers who choose a picturesque route to the Lake District Winston is a good stopping place. A caravan site with camping facilities has been established. Again, this is behind the Post Office and is bounded by trees, conserving the village appearance. In summer many new faces are seen in the village. Numerous cars and caravans from Europe and some cycling groups proudly showing their country's flag are seen on the camp site.
